bibl.title: Letter fragment from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Howard A. Kelly, August 15, 1927

div1.p: [Laura Carter] discusses the location of her father's manuscripts and refers Kelly to Frost.

div1.head: Letter fragment from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Howard A. Kelly, August 15, 1927

opener.dateline:
Care Mr. H. Carter Redd,
Ashland, Hanover County,
Virginia.
August 15, 1927.

div1.p:
In answer to your note inquiring about the availability
of one of my Father's manuscripts, the original copies of several
of his papers are deposited as a permanent loan in the Library of
the Surgeon General of the Army in Washington. To the best of my
present recollection, these manuscripts, with one exception, are
identical with the published papers, except perhaps for minor
editorial revisions. The exception is the manuscript of my Father's
paper “A note on the intervals between infecting and secondary
cases of yellow fever, etc.”, published in the New Orleans Medical
and Surgical Journal in the summer of 1900. This manuscript, as I
recall it, includes several paragraphs, which were omitted from
the paper as published; discussing several possible interpretations
of the observations.

I think it probable that Dr. Frost, at the Johns Hopkins
School of Hygiene, may have a photostat copy of this manuscript. If
so, this copy will be more conveniently accessible than the original
in Washington, and I am sure that Dr. Frost would be glad to lend
it to you.

I am highly appreciative of your interest in my Father's
“services to humanity,” and will be very happy to go over this
manuscript, or any other of his writings, with you on my return to
Baltimore, which will be about the first of October. In the mean-
time you might find it equally satisfactory to go over the manuscript
with Dr. Frost, who has, I think, all the material that I have.
